1.text: SET the trumpet to thy mouth. As an eagle he cometh against the house of the LORD: because they have transgressed my covenant, and trespassed against my law.

2.text: They shall cry unto me, My God, we Israel know thee.

3.text: Israel hath cast off that which is good: the enemy shall pursue him.

4.text: They have set up kings, but not by me; they have made princes, and I knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them idols, that they may be cut off.

5.text: He hath cast off thy calf, O Samaria; mine anger is kindled against them: how long will it be ere they attain to innocency?

6.text: For from Israel is even this; the workman made it, and it is no God: yea, the calf of Samaria shall be broken in pieces.

7.text: For they sow the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind: he hath no standing corn; the blade shall yield no meal; if so be it yield, strangers shall swallow it up.

8.text: Israel is swallowed up: now are they among the nations as a vessel wherein is no pleasure.

9.text: For they are gone up to Assyria, like a wild ass alone by himself: Ephraim hath hired lovers.

10.text: Yea, though they hire among the nations, now will I gather them; and they begin to be minished by reason of the burden of the king of princes.

11.text: Because Ephraim hath multiplied altars to sin, altars have been unto him to sin.

12.text: Though I write for him my law in ten thousand precepts, they are counted as a strange thing.

13.text: As for the sacrifices of mine offerings, they sacrifice flesh and eat it; but the LORD accepteth them not: now will he remember their iniquity, and visit their sins; they shall return to Egypt.

14.text: For Israel hath forgotten his Maker, and builded palaces; and Judah hath multiplied fenced cities: but I will send a fire upon his cities, and it shall devour the castles thereof.
